intro: Tabernaemontana remota, commonly known as the remote tabernacle flower, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, fragrant, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
